file_content.text: Communications program = offline // Further data = unavailable
Emergency protocols = online // Identification + communications program = initializing
What's the emergency, droid?
Encrypting + uplinking
This is Darth Malgus of the Expeditionary Fleet. I bring greetings from the Veragi Sector.
You are the lord who brought Nomen Karr to his knees. Now I ask that you stand at my side and carry the Emperor's banner to war.
I am the Empire's sword. Speak, Malgus.
War is my birthright.
You are the lord who inherited Tulak Hord's secrets. Now I ask you to lend that power to the Emperor's cause, as we begin the march to war.
How would you suggest I contribute?
I'll listen to a fellow Sith.
You are the Cipher who dismantled the terrorist threat to our nation. Now I ask Intelligence to answer the Emperor's call, as we begin the march to war.
How can Intelligence aid you, my lord?
We're here to serve.
You are the bounty hunter who slew Jedi Master Kellian Jarro. Now I ask you to lend your might to our army, as the Emperor calls us to war.
I've done mercenary jobs before. What do you need?
I'll listen to your offer.
You have made unique contributions to our Empire. Now I ask you to lend your might to our army, as the Emperor himself summons us to war.
Not many Sith claim to know the Emperor's will.
The Emperor is involved?
This is an exceptional circumstance, as you will come to understand.
We have other business, Malgus. What if we refuse?
You "ask"? Or "demand"?
I have other business, Malgus. What if I say "no"?
You "ask"? Or "demand"?
Then I will wish you speed and fortune--but I ask you hear me out.
For three centuries, our Emperor has held a Jedi Master prisoner, prolonging his life and his torment.
The Jedi Master possessed a secret--the location of the Foundry, an ancient space station of untold power. Both the Jedi and his Foundry concern us today.
Where does fighting the Republic come into play?
You said we were going to war.
What do we know about the Jedi Master and this space station?
Tell me about them.
Each could dominate worlds. The details are not your immediate concern.
This isn't about senile Jedi and their rusting toys. Get to the point.
Skip the history lesson.
The Emperor sought to pry the Foundry's location from the Jedi's mind. But for centuries, he resisted... so the Emperor has set him free.
Predictably, the Jedi Master fled to his Foundry and brought the Republic armada with him. He has led us to our prize, if we have the courage to claim it.
Releasing the Jedi was a risk, but it may yet pay off. How do we reach our enemy?
I can see the opportunity.
If you have the credits, I have the courage.
Sounds like we have a deal.
The Empire's treasury is open.
The Emperor had three hundred years to break this man... and he never succumbed?
A Jedi resisted the Emperor?
So it seems.
You can justify it how you want, but it sounds like this Jedi got away.
I bet he really just escaped.
Whatever the truth, the advantage must be ours.
A fleet of thirty Terminus-class destroyers is gathering. You may meet with Moff Phennir aboard the flagship, where he is coordinating the attack.
We will capture the Foundry and slay this Jedi at last--and all the Empire will roar in triumph.
Systems = nominal
You have served me well in the past; but today I ask you to lend your might to our army and carry the Emperor's banner to war.
